title: Open Discussion on Volibear
body:
Meddler is wanting to buff Volibear soon so I wanted to make another thread about him 

So lets talk about Volibear, his problems, and where he stands relative to other juggernauts

Volibear is a DPS fighter/tank whose main purpose is to get an early lead and then transition into a meat shield. What he offers are two CCs and an execute with a smidge of AoE damage. He is not an initiator; in fights he plays reactionary, either for peeling or for follow up after the primary tank. He is incredibly good at killing squishy champions, but struggles against tanks due to not building any damage items or penetration. He falls off hard late game. 

From playing him endlessly the past two weeks, these are the problems I think should be addresses either in his VGU or in whatever small changes he'll get soon.

Poor allocation of power. At the moment almost all of his damage budget is tied to his execute, and his ultimate suffers for it. E and R feel very bland and not satisfying.

Season 7 jungle. Volibear has trouble keeping up thanks to these new camps, which is the biggest reason he's actually weak right now.

Too simple. It's impressive that Riot made a champion that manages to be more simple than Garen. His skill cap is his skill floor; there's no tricks to him beyond flash Q.

Dependence on snowballing. Kind of obvious for any stat heavy champion, Volibear is horrible if he falls behind early 

Lack of specialty. Volibear does not excel at anything; his best claim is being able to kill squishes at low health but Darius can turn his execute into a steroid and carry a teamfight. He has no real niche and only becomes popular when his stats are stronger than his competition.

Relative to other juggernauts, what does Volibear offer? Not much. He has the worst time of them in dealing with tanks, others can kill squishes just as easily or easier, and Trundle, Nasus, Darius can all peel for teammates from further than melee range. His sustain is the easiest to deny, too. His peeling is fairly good, though, and with CDR he can spam his flip fairly frequently. He is also the one most dependent on snowballing to stay relevant into mid game.

I would like to see Riot shift power out of W and into his ultimate and passive, and open up some offensive items to him so that he can be more of a fighter than a secondary tank. He will probably need larger changes; if he needs a new role in his rework, I wouldn't mind him being a little more utilitarian and team oriented, given that he currently doesn't play as selfishly as a Darius or Illaoi would. Someone to pick if youd like to be a little more of a team player while still being able to carry.

Interested to hear what you guys think or would like to see Volibear get.

replies.body:
Glad to see some passionate Voli players out there and great feedback! Currently I am planning to experiment with some satisfaction upgrades/light buffs to his ultimate on PBE very soon. 

Live Gameplay works on a lot of stuff at a time and a large scope project for Volibear isn't heavily prioritized over other things right now unfortunately. That said, I feel that there are some easy changes we could make to make his R moments feel a lot cooler with minimal power increase. 

If we did do larger scope work on him, I believe we would try to push him more into a juggernaut territory and re-tune his damages/tankiness around that direction.

I'm incredibly passionate for all Juggernauts. Volibear's the only one that we know for sure is on your guys's plate, so I felt obligated to speak about him. I've got a couple of ideas as far as a large update goes, but for smaller changes I'd really enjoy having some power shuffled around to his ult and for his passive to be conditionally stronger. If you're just looking at his ult, maybe give it some way to hit tanks a little harder? He has trouble fighting other front liners; even just a small amount of % current health damage would do wonders for him. 

Part of what I like about Illaoi/Darius and why I consider them to be the best designs of the group are that they actively reward you for playing aggressively with good healing and a lot of damage (Olaf is a close runner up). Volibear and Garen, and Mundo, don't really give that same satisfaction with their healing, and I find myself dying before the heal is even halfway over late game. Possibly, make the duration of the heal scale down with levels or ult ranks, so that it's the same total but much faster in the later stages?

I think you should look at his E, too. It's not very satisfying due to the instant nature of it, but a 3 second slow/fear to monsters is actually incredibly powerful.

also please elaborate on what you guys are testing

Coming from someone who hates fighting Volibear and yet somehow sees him at the beginning of every season, I'd like to say something about his passive.

Conditionally it secures him an extremely safe early game. I believe that should remain the ONLY advantage, because it is an extreme one. Saying it should be better for teamfights when Volibear consistently gets kited and builds tankier items really is counter-intuitive to the interactions that need to occur. He shouldn't be stronger in a place where he is weakest due to inherent kit flaws or it won't solve much.

If he should have any point where he is strong in the late game, I believe it should be coming from his ultimate only and gated by CD. Something like a Sunfire lightning DoT that does bonus damage on targets that you land spells on rather than AA's. Currently his ult feels like it does nothing unless it's a close 1v1.

You'd be surprised how easy he gets killed even with passive up early. 

The change I suggested doesn't make him strictly 'better' late game -- it's a hopefully net neutral change, weighed off by the fact that his heal being a shorter duration makes applications of Grievous Wounds more powerful, but if he manages to avoid that somehow, his heal will be a bit burstier.

Personally, I'd prefer to have all juggernauts have in-combat sustain rather than 'triggers when you are low HP, activates out of combat' etc. but I'll probably do a separate thread on a complete overhaul for Volibear later

I disagree with quite a few things here, while agreeing with his lack of dmg, demanding more umpf to his ult, OR speed in whatever place, base stats or Q.

1. He can be an initiator, in fact he has to at times, as everyone expects the (only) tank to initiate (right or wrong, it's a thing). His Q being as close as you can get to a Thresh's hook.

2. Idk how late you mean when you say he falls off hard late game. Or when you say he's dependent on snowballing.
What I love about him is that he is one of the few champs that can 1v1 successfully when TWO levels behind, like Vi and I think Yi, as well (I don't own these 2 tho, but I've seen what they can do). Now I managed to do that, and I've seen others do it too. Someone with no smite got a quadra kill with Voli while underleveled and with a score like ~2/8. I helped him throughout the jg knowing it wasn't a lost cause, but how much can you really help someone with no smite, you know? Imo Voli can be really strong, at least mid game, despite being behind. The only problem atm is not him, but the god dam birds, because I have issues with them with other champs, too, made some threads n comments about it since the beginning of this season, and switched to mid and support. Reduce their number, and the jg will be golden. It's prolly why he's mostly played top, last time I checked.

3. I agree with his weird distribution of damage, W being the main one here, and I can add that I feel his kit is asking for the slowing smite rather than the burning one, even though he would benefit from the burning one more. It feels like with his little speed boost he still can't catch some champs at the same level with same level of boots.

4. He has other tricks besides flash q, I'm only a bronzie but I realized I can fear them while chasing with Q. Increase fear's range and he might become op.

>He can be an initiator

He CAN initiate, but he is not good at it, due to it being single target and melee range, and being easily negated by a slow or a stun. By comparison, {{champion:111}} {{champion:113}} {{champion:32}} are much better champions to pick when you only have room for one tank due to more range, AoE CC, and mobility. Volibear is much better off having someone else be the primary initiator, even if he is the main tank. Nautilus top, Leona support, etc. Are what let Volibear get into the fight easier so he can shine. 

>Idk how late you mean when you say he falls off hard late game.

He falls off because his tank stats quickly get shredded to bits after carries purchase their Whisper upgrades, BORK, Void staff, etc. When they are closer to full build, he struggles with doing anything other than becoming a secondary support unless someone else can initiate for him and tank aggro so that he can DPS the carries and execute them. Not to mention how poor his damage output is vs champions with resistances.

>He has other tricks besides flash q, I'm only a bronzie but I realized I can fear them while chasing with Q. Increase fear's range and he might become op.

This is a 'trick' but you should note that his E slows champions, not fears.

Like I said, it's as good as a thresh's hook, not ult. Yes, it's single targeted, but so is let's say a Blitz's hook, and that's all you need to win a team fight if everyone is there and committed. You instagib the first victim, then the 5v4 starts.

Voli has many problems.

One of Voli's most egregious problems is itemization. Two abilities in his kit scale with attack speed, but juggernaut items don't support that stat. You can grab a {{item:3078}}, but that's not a lot of defensive stats for a melee frontliner with a single, conditional defensive ability built in his kit. Even {{champion:122}} won't buy one unless he's incredibly ahead early on.

Granted, W takes care of itself somewhat because of the innate AS it grants, but the ult is just so underwhelming if you can't proc it a lot. This is made even worse since Voli can have a tough time sticking to more mobile champions to get autos off in the first place, despite his flip. There's counterplay, then there's a self-countering kit.

I would say his ult could be changed to something like {{champion:53}}  or {{champion:85}}  has, where lighting strikes in an AoE around him when he activates it. To help separate Voli's ult from the other abilities, his ult could apply grounding to everyone struck by the bolts to give him a unique flavor and help him overcome kiting in his moment of strength.
